description:
Google Cloud teams work with schools, companies, and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile and collaborative. You will oversee all aspects of the Google Cloud sales process, improving it with your insightful data analysis, troubleshooting, and seamless cross-functional teamwork. Your strategies ensure that companies new to Google products get the highest quality customer support and that the Google Cloud program overall is kept on the cutting edge.

As a Global Partner Lead, you will ensure that Google Cloud's products and solutions translate to a sound and relevant technology platform for our Accenture partners by leveraging their vertical and functional expertise. You will define the solution strategy with Accenture, build a cross-functional team, create critical relationships with C-level partners, and showcase Google’s innovation and technology solutions to our potential customers. You will also work closely with Google Cloud Sales leaders across all markets and be seen as a collaborative thought partner to ensure productive Sales engagement across the globe. Additionally, you will partner with Product, Legal, Compliance, and Enablement to remove barriers and ensure flawless execution and success of the alliances.

In this role, you will contribute experience in strategy and sales, a technical aptitude, and passion for transforming large companies through Google Cloud’s technologies. You will leverage product experience to help design go-to-market solutions and establish relationships with key executives within the Global Services Infrastructure organization.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in strategy consulting and/or go-to-market business development.
  • Experience managing multi-stakeholders and product solutions.
  • Experience leveraging relationships with global system integrators.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience using Google technologies to develop businesses.
  • Experience as an advisor to key technology decision makers on strategic plans.
  • Experience in Computer Science. direct sales, channel sales, or strategic alliances.
  • Understanding of how Global Technology stakeholders operate. Established network of contacts within the industry
  • Understanding of how the C-suite build and views technology as a strategic asset to their business.
  • Understanding of how to use cloud and mobile technology to generate strategic differentiation within the customers across industries and geographies. Ability to discuss collaboration, cloud, mobility technologies, trends, and benefits with the C-suite.
responsibilities:
• Develop a go-to-market strategy for our partners with the objective of optimizing Google technologies and products to help customers transform their businesses. Work with these partners in developing solutions that leverage their unique talents and go-to-market skills.
  • Define measures of success with each relationship and use data to analyze success. Predict and manage the evolution of our relationships.
  • Build and foster relationships with partner executives, their customer CxOs and Google leaders.
  • Mentor team members, guide their immediate and long-term direction and results. Work collaboratively with the rest of Google Cloud and other Google teams in maintaining long-term productive partnerships.
  • Define, review, and agree to a clear set of priorities, joint initiatives, and strategies with our partners.
title: Global Partner Lead, Global Consulting Partnerships, Google Cloud
